info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern York and central Cherokee Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 759 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Gaffney, or near Smyrna, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Blacksburg, Hickory Grove, Smyrna, Kings Mountain State Park, Grover, Cherokee Falls, Draytonville, Saratt and Kings Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
